alert.note: Alert for Boone; Carroll; Gallatin; Grant; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN CARROLL, SOUTHERN BOONE, GRANT, CENTRAL OWEN AND CENTRAL GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 320 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 8 miles west of Owenton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Walton, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Owenton, Glencoe, Sanders, Sparta, Gratz, Stewartsville, Ryle, Northcutt, Interstate 71 at US Route 127, Wheatley, New Liberty, Elmer Davis Lake, Sherman, Elliston, Munk and Cherry Grove. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 55 and 75. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 152 and 166, and near mile marker 170. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
